entry.title: Blaze Gel - Wood Burning Gel
entry.summary:
Vendor: Design Blanks
Type:
Price: 21.00 - 36.00 (2 variants)

Blaze Gel - Wood Burning Compound

Open up your options by adding wood burning to your resume.

All of the instructions are included but it's a simple add water and stir recipe. Apply to your wood project over your desired stencil (or freehand your design with a paintbrush), let dry, apply heat using a heat gun. Ta-da! Admire your results.

25gm size makes more than 5.5oz of gel

50gm size makes more than 11oz of gel

Made in Canada

entry.title: Chalk It Up - Chalk Powder Bundle with Acccessories SAVE 20%
entry.summary:
Vendor: Chalk It Up
Type:
Price: 21.20

The Chalk It Up Bundle includes

  • one full size 150gm/5oz package of Chalk It Up chalk powder
  • one Stainless clipping Scoop
  • one Stainless Stir Stick
  • one small grey Silicone Squeegee
  • two 2oz plastic chalk paste jars

Your easy DIY Chalk Paste and Chalk Paint Solution!

100% all-natural chalk powder. Make smooth creamy chalk paste for all of your stencil projects. 

Try our favourite chalk paste recipe! Add Chalk It Up to Country Chic chalk style furniture paints to make out of this world chalk paste. Less Chalk It Up chalk powder is used when your starting paint is already chalk-based paint. 

Make Chalk Paste

Add Chalk It Up Chalk Powder to acrylic paint to make thick creamy chalk paste. Approximately a 1:1 ratio. 2 tbsp Chalk It Up mixed with 2 tbsp paint. More or less until desired consistency is reached. 

Make Chalk Paint

Add Chalk It Up Chalk Powder to latex paint to make matte, creamy chalk paint. Chalk paint has superior adhesion and distresses beautifully. Pre-mix approximately 8 tbsp Chalk It Up powder with 4 tbsp water until smooth. Add to one cup of latex paint and keep mixing until smooth.

With Chalk It Up, The sky is the limit when it comes to custom chalk paste and chalk paint colours.

150gm/5oz package by weight.

entry.title: Triggerjet Nozzle
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 49.50

The TriggerJet Nozzle is a pressure spray nozzle with a flat spray trajectory that can be used with a standard garden hose connection for washing out your Ikonart stencil films. If you have a laundry sink in your house or if you are able to get a hose adapter for your kitchen/bathroom faucet, the TriggerJet Nozzle can make washing out your Ikonart stencil films much faster compared to using a standard kitchen sink sprayer. 

Note: This durable polypropylene nozzle can simulate the equivalent of approximately 150 PSI (10 bar).

Hooking Up Your TriggerJet Nozzle

You will need to use a faucet adapter and hose with this TriggerJet Nozzle. The adapter will depend on what faucet you are trying to attach the nozzle to.

entry.title: Ikonart Textile Film 12" x 18"
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 115.00

These 12" x 18" sheets are perfect for larger signs, chalkboards, porch signs, etc.

Larger stencil films are designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit, but the kit MUST be modified with the Extender Bar to raise the light up higher. You will also need to flip the light around and expose your film on a smooth, flat surface (pictured above).

Note: If you are looking for a less sticky stencil for glass, mirrors, ceramic, chalkboards, or other smooth surfaces, check out our Ikonart Stencil Film. Our original blue film was designed with a lighter adhesive for easier printing on smooth, flat surfaces. 

Ikonart Stencil Film - 12"x18" Size:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Must raise the light using the Extender Bar
  • Use with our 11"x17" Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film (you can also piece together multiple 8"x11" sheets)
  • Reusable, customizable, easy-to-use, repositionable
  • Perfect for fabric, textiles, wood and textured surfaces
  • Mesh Count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 12 in. x 18 in. (30.5 cm x 45.7 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 10-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide for original Ikonart Kit (with acrylic stand)
  • User Guide for Ikonart Kit 2.0 (with metal stand)
  • SDS for Ikonart Stencil Film available upon request

USING THE 12" X 18" STENCIL FILM

  1. ADJUST STAND: Swap out the regular 18” bar with the 23” Extender Bar. You must use the Extender Bar to raise the light. Flip the light around so the light is over a smooth, flat surface instead of over the base (see picture above). 
  2. EXPOSE FILM: Place your Ikonart Stencil Film on a smooth, flat surface with the textured side facing up. The longer side of the film should be parallel with the base of the stand (see picture above). Place artwork on top of the Stencil Film so you can read it. Top everything with the clear exposure sheet (included in the film pack) and rub down to ensure a good seal between the film positive and the stencil film. Turn on the exposure unit and expose for 1 minute and 40 seconds.
  3. WASHOUT FILM: Washout is exactly the same as the smaller 10”x12” Stencil Film. Do not washout in front of a bright window. Washout your stencil using warm water until all mesh areas are clear of the emulsion.
  4. POST-EXPOSE FILM: DO NOT SKIP THIS STEP. When your imaged stencil is completely dry, post-expose under the light for a minimum of 5 minutes. Post-exposing increases the durability when reusing your stencils. A clear sheet is not needed for post-exposure. Optional: flip the film over halfway through post-exposure so you are post-exposing from both sides of the film (front and back). 

CARING FOR YOUR STENCILS

Ikonart Stencil Film is light sensitive and should remain in the packaging it comes in until you are ready to expose it. The film must stay out of the sunlight and bright lights before exposure and during washout. Keep unused stencil film in the black bag when not in use.

The unexposed film has a shelf life of at least one year from the date of manufacture if stored and handled properly. For storage of the Ikonart Stencil Film, before it is exposed, we recommend storing it in a cool, dry place. Temperatures should not be below freezing or above 85°F. After the film is exposed, your finished stencils should be stored flat in a dry area.

Do not soak your stencils in water for extended periods of time. Do not use any chemicals (such as cleaning wipes) when washing paint off your stencils, as these chemicals can break down the emulsion and adhesive. 

INCREASE STICKINESS

If you over-washed your stencils and they don’t seem sticky enough, try one of these tips to make them stickier.

  1. Use a damp paper towel or fine mister to lightly moisten the adhesive side.
  2. Huff on (exhale hot air) the adhesive side of the stencil before applying to your surface
  3. Use a small handheld steamer to lightly steam the adhesive side.
  4. Rub-down the stencil really well before you apply your paint/paste/link to activate the adhesive.
  5. Use a spray adhesive to make the stencils stickier.

QUICK START GUIDE

See the Ikonart Quick Start Guide for full instructions. The guide is also included in the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit.

SAFETY INFORMATION

Our stencil films are made in the USA at our headquarters in Duluth, Minnesota. They have been independently tested by InfoTox International to ensure they are safe when used as directed. They meet all health requirements of the Labeling of Hazardous Art Materials Act (LHAMA) and conform to ASTM D-4236.

If you over-washed your stencils and they don’t seem sticky enough, try one of these tips to make them stickier.

  4. Rub-down the stencil really well before you apply your paint/paste/link to activate the adhesive.
  5. Use a spray adhesive to make the stencils stickier.

See the Ikonart Quick Start Guide for full instructions. The guide is also included in the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit.

They meet all health requirements of the Labeling of Hazardous Art Materials Act (LHAMA) and conform to ASTM D-4236.

entry.title: Extender Bar for 12"X18" Film
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ikonart
Type:
Price: 14.50

Larger stencil films are designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit, but the kit MUST be modified with this Extender Bar to raise the light up higher. This Extender Bar should be used with the 12"x18" Ikonart Textile Film and the 12"x18" Ikonart Stencil Film.

SETUP

This Extender Bar is compatible with the original acrylic Ikonart Exposure Stand or the new metal Ikonart Exposure Stand. Just remove the original shorter bar and replace with this Extender Bar in order to raise the light. You will need to flip the light around so it is not over the base when exposing the large film sheets. 

EXPOSURE

Flip the light around so it is facing away from the base. Place your film on a smooth, flat surface so the long edge of your film is parallel with the base of the stand. See pictures above for reference. Expose your film for 1 minute and 40 seconds when using this Extender Bar. Note: You can expose the 10"x12" or 12"x18" sheets with this Extender Bar on your exposure stand. 

After you washout and dry your film, post-expose for 5-6 minutes. Optional: flip the film over halfway through post-exposure so you are post-exposing from both sides of the film (front and back).

entry.title: Ikonart TEXTILE KIT Add-On Bundle
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 61.00

Introducing the Ikonart Textile Bundle. This add-on bundle includes everything you need to get started with DIY screen printing using the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit. Save 15% when you buy the bundle vs. buying the products individually! 

DIY screen printing doesn't need to be hard. When you combine the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit along with our Ikonart Textile Bundle, you will be making your own custom shirts, throw pillows, tea towels, and more in just a few simple steps. The bundle includes a Tacky Textile Mat to hold down your fabric, Textile Film to make your reusable stencils, Speedball screen printing ink to print with, and a black silicone squeegee to screen print your custom design. Screen printing on fabric has never been easier.   

Bundle Includes:

  • 5 pack of Textile Film
  • 12x12 Tacky Textile Mat
  • Black Silicone Squeegee

Our tacky adhesive mats make screen printing with our Ikonart Textile Film so much easier. Use the tacky mat under fabric to hold the fabric in place while you apply your paint or ink. The mat also helps to block the paint or ink from bleeding through. Use the clear film cover to protect the adhesive when not in use. 

Note: To prevent warping, avoid extreme heat. Do not iron on the mat, do not use a heat gun or place in direct sunlight.

  • Standard adhesive

entry.title: Speedball Ink - Black 4oz
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 9.95

Speedball Screen Printing ink offers great coverage, smooth workability, and easy cleanup. This water-based ink is permanent on fabric once properly heat set.

After printing on fabric your ink will dry, but you still need to “cure” your ink to the fabric, also known as heat setting. Speedball water-based fabric inks can be cured by using a household iron. Check your iron settings compared to the fabric you printed on. Use only fabrics that can be subjected to temperatures of at least 275°-375° F. Do not use nonporous fabrics such as nylon. Place a piece of paper (simple copy paper is best) over top of your printed design and cure with a hot iron for 1-2 minutes.

  • Water-soluble screen printing ink
  • Made for printing on paper and textiles
  • Perfect for t-shirts
  • Easy clean up with soap and water
  • 4 oz. jar of black ink

entry.title: Etchall Etching Creme 4oz
entry.summary:
Vendor: Design Blanks
Type:
Price: 29.95

Etchall Etching Crème is a re-usable cream that produces a white opaque, permanent etched finish on glass, mirror, ceramic, porcelain, marble, and slate.

When using Etchall with Ikonart Smart Stencils, follow the directions on the bottle. Protect your work area. Clean the surface to be etched. Apply stencil and rub-down the edges to remove all air bubbles. Tape off the edges if needed. Apply a heavy coat of Etchall to open areas on the stencil. Let creme sit for 15 minutes. You can scrape off the excess creme and return to a container for re-use if desired. Flush etched surface with water to remove the remaining creme before removing the stencil. 

After you etch, you can add a product like Rub n Buff or colored wax paste to your etched design for color. 

Storage: Store at 65-85F (18-30 C) in the original container. Exposure to temperatures above 85F will cause creme discoloration, but will not affect creme usability or performance. Temperatures below 65F will produce crystals. If crystals are present, place the closed container in warm water for several minutes, then stir until crystals dissolve. 

  • Permanent etch
  • Re-usable
  • Made in the USA
  • Ages 12 and up
  • 4 oz.

entry.title: Inkjet Printer Film - Ikonart
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 16.45 - 142.00 (4 variants)

Our Inkjet Printer Film is specifically engineered for the creation of superior quality film positives. We add a special coating on the emulsion side of our Inkjet Printer Film in order to increase the density of your final artwork and give you the best positive possible for creating your stencils.

Important Note: When printing on the Inkjet Printer Film, it is important that you print on the EMULSION side of the film. The emulsion side is the side that is NOT shiny. 

Inkjet Printer Guide: Read our Inkjet Printer Guide for tips on how to set up your inkjet printer for the best film positive possible. Includes printer setting recommendations, artwork tips, how to troubleshoot common problems, and inkjet printer recommendations.

  • To be used with Inkjet Printers
  • Ink dries instantly
  • 8.5 in. x 11 in. (21.6 cm x 27.9 cm) available in 10-sheet or 100-sheet packs
  • 11 in. x 17 in. (27.9 cm x 43.2 cm) available in 25 or 100-sheet packs
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)

PLEASE NOTE: This is NOT a heat transfer film or iron-on film. In order to use this film for shirts, you must first make a stencil using our Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit. You can not use this Inkjet Printer Film directly on fabric.

entry.title: Laser Printer Film - Ikonart
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 16.45 - 142.00 (4 variants)

Our Laser Printer Film is a heat-stable drafting film for the creation of positives to be used when exposing Ikonart Stencil Film. It is an economical alternative to more expensive orthochromatic film. Laser Printer Film offers excellent toner retention keeping the black areas dense enough to block UV light during exposure. 

Important Note: If you find that your stencils are not holding the detail that you would like, you may not be getting enough density with your laser printer. Try the Toner Enhancement Spray on your Laser Printer Film. The density of your ink is important so that it blocks the UV light from the Ikonart Stencil Film during exposure. This is especially important for high detail artwork.  

  • To be used with Laser Printers
  • Sheet Size: 8.5 in. x 11 in. (21.6 cm x 27.9 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 10-Sheet or 100-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Cedartown, GA)

entry.title: Ikonart Textile Film 10" x 12"
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 40.00 - 148.00 (3 variants)

Ikonart Smart Screen Stencils are the fastest, smartest, and easiest way to create custom stencils at home. This film is just like our original blue stencil film, but stickier and slightly more rigid which makes it the perfect film for printing on fabric, wood, and other textured or difficult surfaces. 

Create customized stencils for your t-shirts and other textile printing in three simple steps!

  1. PRINT - Design artwork and print onto Inkjet Film or Laser Film.
  2. EXPOSE - Expose printed image onto the IKONART Stencil Film using the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit. Exposure time is 35 seconds using the Ikonart light stand. Please note that exposure times will vary if you use a different exposure light. We highly recommend using our Ikonart exposure unit for the best results. 
  3. RINSE - Rinse film to reveal your stencil!

After your stencil dries, you are ready to start using your stencil. The possibilities are endless! 

NOTE ON POST-EXPOSURE

Post-exposing our Ikonart Textile Film will increase the durability when reusing your stencils. After you washout and dry your stencil for the first time, just pop it back under the exposure light for a minimum of 2 minutes (we recommend 2-3 minutes; you cannot over post-expose the film). This step is absolutely necessary to increase the durability when washing and re-washing your stencil for multiple uses.

NOTE: When ordering your stencil film, don't forget to also order either Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film so you can make your stencils!

IKONART Smart Screen Stencils:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Reusable
  • Customizable
  • Easy-to-use
  • Repositionable
  • Mesh count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 10 in. x 12 in. (25.4 cm x 30.5 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 5-Sheet, 10-Sheet or 25-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide

entry.title: Ikonart Stencil Film 10" x 12"

Price: 40.00 - 148.00 (3 variants)

Blue stencils are perfect for glass, mirrors, ceramic, chalkboards, and all smooth, flat surfaces. The adhesive is gentle enough so the stencils won't distort when you are removing them from these types of smooth surfaces.

EXPOSE - Expose printed image onto the Ikonart Stencil Film using the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit. Exposure time is 35 seconds using the Ikonart light stand. Please note that exposure times will vary if you use a different exposure light. We highly recommend using our Ikonart exposure unit for the best results. 
  3. RINSE - Rinse film to reveal your stencil!

After your stencil dries, you are ready to start using your stencil. The possibilities are endless! 

Our original Ikonart Stencil Film is designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit to create custom, reusable silkscreen stencils. These blue stencils are perfect for glass, mirrors, ceramic, chalkboards and other smooth, flat surfaces. The adhesive is gentle enough so the stencils won't distort when you are removing them from these types of smooth surfaces. 

If you are looking for stickier stencils for shirts, tea towels, pillow covers, fabric, textiles, wood, or other textured surfaces, check out our Ikonart Textile Film. This new purple film was specifically designed for DIY screen printing on textiles, but the more aggressive adhesive makes it the perfect choice for wood projects as well. 

NOTE ON POST-EXPOSURE

Post-exposing our Ikonart Stencil Film will increase the durability when reusing your stencils! After you washout and dry your stencil for the first time, just pop it back under the exposure light for a minimum of 2 minutes (we recommend 2-3 minutes; you cannot over post-expose the film). This step is absolutely necessary to increase the durability when washing and re-washing your stencil for multiple uses. 2-3 minutes will give you more durability for a wide variety of washout conditions.

NOTE: When ordering your stencil film, don't forget to also order either Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film so you can make your stencils!

Ikonart Smart Screen Stencils:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Reusable
  • Customizable
  • Easy-to-use
  • Repositionable
  • Mesh count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 10 in. x 12 in. (25.4 cm x 30.5 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 5-Sheet, 10-Sheet or 25-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide

entry.title: Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit **NEW 2.0 Version
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 275.00

Create custom stencils with the complete Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit! This revolutionary kit contains a silkscreen stencil film designed to make reusable, custom stencils at home. Ikonart Smart Screen Stencils are the fastest, smartest, and easiest way to create custom stencils in three easy steps - print, expose & rinse.

Ikonart Kit 2.0 Features

We introduced the next generation of the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit in October of 2020. The Ikonart Kit 2.0 features:

  • Exposure stand is metal instead (vs acrylic)
  • Weight of new exposure stand with light is 4lbs (vs 7lbs)
  • Base has a black matte coating, so matte black cardboard is no longer needed
  • Overall footprint is 14"x14" (vs 16"x16")
  • 30W light is smaller is size (vs 20W larger light)
  • All lights in the 2.0 kits will have an on/off switch
  • New Quick Start Packet with a printed artwork example and finished stencil example

Ikonart Custom Stencil Making Kit Includes:

  • Exposure Stand (dimensions when setup 14" W x 14" L x 18.5" H)
  • UV LED Light (120 Voltage, 30 Watt, 3 prong cord)
  • Ikonart Stencil Film (10" x 12" 5-Sheet Pack, Made in the USA)
  • Inkjet Film (8.5" x 11" 5-Sheet Pack, Made in the USA)
  • Laser Film (8.5" x 11" 5-Sheet Pack, Made in the USA)
  • Clipboard
  • Squeegee
  • Exposure Stand Setup Guide
  • User Guide for original Ikonart (with acrylic stand)
  • User Guide for Ikonart Kit 2.0 (with metal stand)
  • Printed Inkjet Sample
  • Finished Stencil Sample

GOOD ARTWORK & PRINTER SETTINGS
A good stencil starts with good artwork. Read our High Quality Artwork Guide before making your stencils. Depending on if you have an inkjet or laser printer, please also read our Inkjet Printer Guide or Laser Printer Guide for printer setting recommendations, artwork tips, how to troubleshoot common problems and printer recommendations.

NOTE ON POST-EXPOSURE

Post-exposing our Ikonart Stencil Film will increase the durability when reusing your stencils! After you washout and dry your stencil for the first time, just pop it back under the exposure light for a minimum of 2 minutes (we recommend 2-3 minutes; you cannot over post-expose the film). This step is absolutely necessary to increase the durability when washing and re-washing your stencil for multiple uses. Originally we had recommended 30 seconds, which is plenty of time if you are only using the stencil once, or if you are very gentle when you washout. However, 2-3 minutes will give you more durability for a wide variety of washout conditions.
